newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi Aramco awards oil exploration contract.
newsitem.headline: Saudi Aramco awards oil exploration contract.

text.p: Egyptian-Saudi Petroleum Exploration and Drilling Company (ESPED) has signed a three-year exploration contract with Saudi state oil firm Saudi Aramco, the English-language Arab News paper reported on Sunday.
ESPED's contract would cover exploration work at the Rub Al Khali or Empty Quarter in the east of Saudi Arabia.
Officials from the two companies were meeting to finalise the drilling programme that will use drilling equipment shipped from the United States, Arab News reported.
ESPED is 70 percent owned by the Egyptian General Organisation for Petroleum and 30 percent by an unnamed Saudi trade and investment company, the paper said.
Saudi Arabia is the world's largest oil producer.
